page.title: 16BARLOW VILLAGE 3
page.content: The land between{Barlow Church}and {Dunston Hole Farm}is now restored to fields after several years of {open-cast coal mining.It is again used for mixed crops and cattle. The{Sud {Brook}continues to flow from{West {to East}to join the{Barlow Brook and then both join the{River Rother. The farm at{Dunston Hole}has grown a {record crop}this last{year-1985-}and many local farmers are being invited to see how it was done.The most North Easterly corner of our area is{King's {Wood}which is a{medieval}name and lies to the North of{Dunston Hole. }The hill behind this is now run by the {Forestry Commission}and they have planted the hillside with several stands of{broad-leaved trees.}Usually, {man-made forests}are planted with {quick growing softwoods.}The{B6051 {road }runs from{North to South.
